posts.post_content:
Where evil rules all, hope for mana-fixing has no champion.  
  
I suppose the Baron is plenty powerful, but very stingy about loaning that power out to the planeswalkers that show up on his doorstep. In invisible ink the card says "![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol), sacrifice a non-Vampire creature: Add ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) to your mana pool. Play this ability only if you are Baron Sengir."
posts.html:
Where evil rules all, hope for mana-fixing has no champion.

I suppose the Baron is plenty powerful, but very stingy about loaning that power out to the planeswalkers that show up on his doorstep. In invisible ink the card says ", sacrifice a non-Vampire creature: Add to your mana pool. Play this ability only if you are Baron Sengir."
